channel.title: xslt-1.0 Tutorial on
channel.description: Recent content in xslt-1.0 Tutorial on

item.title: Getting started with xslt-1.0
item.description: Identity transformation using the “identity rule” # This example shows the base of almost any XSLT transformation and the most fundamental XSLT design pattern. Producing as output an XML document that is identical to the source XML document. Source XML document: <t>Hello, World!</t> XSLT transformation: <xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"> <xsl:output omit-xml-declaration="yes" indent="yes"/> <xsl:template match="@*|node()"> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates select="@*|node()"/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet> Result: When applying this transformation on any source XML document, the output is an XML document that is identical to the source XML document.
